Amazingly, there is no way (with either this app or the website) to VERIFY who you are sending money to. As a result, most people (including friends) that I've dealt with on PayPal, send a token amount (a few pennies, JUST LIKE BANKS DO), verify (by other means) that the amount was received by the intended recipient, & then send the balance. This problem occurs even with friends you have already sent money to: You can't verify the eMail address (which may have changed) of someone in your contact list. As a result, the contact list IS USELESS in many cases!!! You can't even edit the name in the contact list to help distinguish similar or ambiguous names. As a result, this is FAR from a bulletproof app. One wonders about other security features & policies of the company. Moral: BUYER BEWARE with this app.

They simply pass you on to the next person, then to the next phone number(!!) until there's literally no one else at the end of that line. I am writing more about PayPal service than the app. I have been in business for over 25 years and have never come across a service as poor as PayPal and cannot recommend it to anyone. We have recently launched an online business through Shopify and had integrated PayPal into our store as a credit card processor. Of our first dozen orders, 7 chose PayPal to process and due to their "security processing", all 7 of our orders were held up for a minimum of 5 days and we have 1 of them that has now been held 20 days. I have spoken to PayPal 2 times and get the same story from the reps - this is our security procedures to protect you. Shopify payments process through in 24 hours and we feel quite protected. After they have held onto our payment for this long, then they ask for another 1% to release funds immediately. My most transaction released was for approximately $150. The order came in on 4/26, just got released today, May 5th. I tried to transfer to our bank and I was informed they were going to hold onto this up to another 72 hours. I can't believe any small business can operate with their payment processor holding onto cash for up to 21 days.
